articles.title: Newly-observed oxygen-28 nucleus fails 'double magic' test – Physics World - physicsworld.com
articles.description: Super-heavy isotope was the last remaining artificial candidate for extra-stable status
articles.content:
Isotope factory: The Radioactive Isotope Beam Factory (RIBF) at RIKEN in Wako, Japan, provided the ion beam used to create the first oxygen-28 atoms. (Courtesy: RIKEN)

articles.title: Black holes may be lurking closer to Earth than previously thought - Euronews
articles.description: The closest black hole to Earth was thought to be 1,560 light-years away - but a new study suggests there could be one around 150 light-years away.
articles.content:
The closest black hole to Earth was thought to be 1,560 light-years away - but a new study suggests there could be one around 150 light-years away.
